description: Prairie milkweed (Asclepias sullivantii) is an amazing plant species native to the tallgrass prairies of the Midwest. This species of milkweed is incredibly attractiverare, and important to the local ecosystem. Its long, woody stems and showy clusters of white, fragrant flowers make it a beautiful addition to any garden. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators from monarch butterflies, to bumble bees, and hummingbirds. Furthermore, its sturdy root system helps to stabilize the soil, promote water infiltration, and reduce soil erosion. Prairie milkweed is an important, long-lasting, and beautiful species of plant that all gardeners should consider adding to their yards.
